properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 11 at 3:15PM CST until February 13 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Kansas City/Pleasant HIll MO
properties.description:
...Wintry Mess Wednesday...

.A winter weather storm will spread across eastern Kansas and
Missouri Wednesday morning, lingering through late Wednesday
night. This storm will start with snow Wednesday morning, but
surface temperatures will likely warm up just enough to convert
the precipitation type to rain by the late morning to early
afternoon hours, with a mix of rain and snow through the afternoon.
However, temperatures will crash back down Wednesday evening as a
strong cold front catchs up to the broad area of precipitation
still occurring across the region. This will result in sufficent
snowfall Wednesday night to warrent keeping the advisory going
through midnight as the whole system moves east. Snowfall totals
are low confidence owing to the above freezing temperatures
expected during the day Wednesday, but expect enough mixed wintry
precipitation to warrant going with a widespread winter advisory.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3
inches.

* WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Kansas and
central, north central and west central Missouri.

* WHEN...From 9 AM Wednesday to midnight CST Wednesday night.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the evening commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1 in Kansas or visiting
traveler.modot.org in Missouri.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM WEDNESDAY TO MIDNIGHT CST WEDNESDAY NIGHT
